Command Versatility.Effect: Your Pokémon may give up use of a Scene or Daily Move to regain use of a Scene or Daily Move which it has already used. Your Pokémon may give up use of a Daily Move to regain use of a Scene Move, but not vice-versa. You may use Command Versatility only once per Scene per Pokémon.

Press.Effect: You hit your Pokémon, and they lose 1/6th of their Max Hit Points and are cured of Sleep. Raise any two of their Stats by +1 CS each, and you may add half of your Intimidate Rank to any Skill Checks made this round to make this Pokémon obey orders. Using Press on a Pokémon may make them dislike you.

Quick Switch.Trigger: Your Pokémon Faints; or an opponent sends out a Pokémon
Quick Switch.Effect: You may return and send out a Pokémon as a Free Action. You may perform this Feature on your turn without a Trigger. Pokémon sent out by Quick Switch cannot trigger another Trainer's Quick Switch. When you swap Pokémon using Quick Switch, you do not lose a Pokémon turn.

Species Savant.Prerequisites: 3 different individual Pokémon of the same evolutionary line
Species Savant.Effect: When you take Species Savant, choose a single Evolutionary Family. Your Pokémon of your Chosen Evolutionary Family have each of their Base Stats increased by +1.

Tutoring.Prerequisites: Skills Pokémon Education 3, A move that you or three of your Pokémon know
Tutoring.Frequency: One Time Use x 3 — Extended Action
Tutoring.Effect: When activating this Feature, select a Move known either by yourself or by 3 Pokémon you own. This Move is Mastered. As an Extended Action, you may have Pokémon spend 2 Tutor Points to learn a Move you have Mastered. Pokémon targeted this way can only learn Moves that they could learn by Level Up, TM, Egg Move, or Move Tutor. You may take Tutoring multiple times, each time gaining 3 uses of the Feature

Agility Training.Effect: The target becomes Agile until the end of the effect duration. Agile Pokémon gain a +1 bonus to Movement Capabilities and +4 to Initiative.

Brutal Training.Effect: The target becomes Brutal until the end of the effect duration. Brutal Pokémon increase the Critical- Hit and Effect Range of all attacks by +1.

Focused Training.Effect: The target becomes Focused until the end of the effect duration. Focused Pokémon gain a +1 bonus to Accuracy Rolls and +2 to Skill Checks.

Inspired Training.Effect: The target becomes Inspired until the end of the effect duration. Inspired Pokémon gain a +1 bonus to Evasion and +2 to Save Checks.

Commander's Voice.Effect:
You may give two different [Orders] as a single Standard Action, or you may give one set of [Orders] as a Swift Action.
If this is used to use Focused Command and another [Order] that has targets, the second Order applies to both Pokémon you are commanding that turn. Commander's Voice doesn't allow you to use Focused Command as a Swift Action.

Focused Command.Prerequisites: Skills Command 6, Focus 5, Guile 5, Intimidate 5, Pokémon Education 5
Focused Command.Effect: You may have a second Pokémon take a turn this round, but both Pokémon can only take At-Will actions that round. Additionally, both Pokémon receive a -5 Penalty on all Damage Rolls. You may pay 1 AP at the beginning of the round to lift the Frequency Restriction OR the Damage Penalty for the remainder of the round, or pay 2 AP to lift both.

Ravager Orders.Effect: You gain the Reckless Advance and Strike Again! Orders.

Marksman Orders.Effect: You gain the Trick Shot and Long Shot Orders.

Trickster Orders.Effect: You gain the Capricious Whirl and Dazzling Dervish Orders.

Guardian Orders.Effect: You gain the Brace for Impact and Sentinel Stance Orders.

Precision Orders.Effect: You gain the Pinpoint Strike and Perfect Aim Orders.

Blur.Effect: Attacks and Moves targeting you that don't require an Accuracy Check now require one, as though they had Accuracy Check of 2. You may only apply half of your Evasion to these Attacks and Moves.

Defender.Effect: Using the Intercept Maneuvers requires only a Shift Action Interrupt.

Dive.Trigger: You are targeted by a Ranged 1-Target Attack, or are in a Cone, Burst, Blast, or Line.
Dive.Effect: You may immediately Shift 1 Meter, and then become Tripped. This Feature cannot be used if you are Stuck, Grappled, or otherwise impaired from Shifting. This Feature causes you to dodge Ranged attacks aimed at you, and may let you avoid Cones, Bursts, Blasts, or Lines if the shift removes you from the area of effect.

Fighter's Versatility.Prerequisites: Moves Freq Scene, Daily, Freq Scene, Daily
Fighter's Versatility.Effect: You may give up use of a Scene or Daily Move to regain use of a Scene or Daily Move which you have already used. You may give up use of a Daily Move to regain use of a Scene Move, but not vice-versa.

Multi-Tasking.Effect: You may take two Standard Actions instead of one this turn, but both actions must have an At-Will Frequency.

Signature Move.Effect: Choose a Move you know. Increase the Move's Frequency one step, as if you had used a PP Up. This choice cannot be changed once made. This Feature may not select Moves known through temporary means, nor can these Moves be used to qualify for this Feature.

Type Expertise.Prerequisites:
Rank 1: Level 9
Moves Type x, Type x, Type x
Rank 2: Level 9
Moves Type x, Type x, Type x
Type Expertise.Effect: Each Rank, choose a Type of which you know at least 3 Moves. You gain STAB for the chosen Type. STAB is never applied to Struggle Attacks.

Walk It Off.Effect: Remove one Injury from yourself and regain 1/4th of your maximum Hit Points. This Injury removal doesn't count against the natural healing limit on Injuries each day.

First Aid Expertise.Prerequisites:
Edges Medic Training
Skills Medicine Education 5
First Aid Expertise.Effect: The target may remove one Injury, has all Hit Points restored, and is cured of all Status Afflictions. You may use First Aid Expertise only once per day per target. First Aid Expertise requires access to a First Aid Kit.

Let Me Help You With That.Trigger: An allied Trainer fails a Skill Check in a Skill you have Ranked at Novice or higher.
Let Me Help You With That.Effect: The ally may re-roll the Skill Check with a Bonus equal to your Skill Rank.

Poké Ball Crafter.Prerequisites:
Edges Basic Balls, Poké Ball Repair
Skills Technology 5
Poké Ball Crafter.Effect: You may craft Dusk, Dive, Heal, Luxury, Net, Nest, Quick, Repeat, or Timer Balls for $700. Requires access to a Poké Ball Tool Box.

PokéManiac.Effect: Make a Pokemon Education Check with a DC of 10. If you succeed, you determine the target's Level, Types, Nature, and Abilities.

Psionic Sight.Effect: You are able to visibly see any Psychic Residue left on Humans or Pokémon due to the effects of Psionic abilities. Each Human or Pokémon leaves distinct Psychic Residue on their targets; you are easily able to distinguish which targets have been affected by the same Psionic, though to identify that Psionic you need to have a way of knowing their signature (such as simply seeing them do it, and seeing the resulting signature).

Skill Monkey.Effect: You may re-roll the triggering Skill Check with a +2 Bonus, taking the new result. This Feature may be used to re-roll a specific roll only once.

Arcane Training.Effect: You may use Arcane Weapons. Attacks made with your Arcane Weapons share the Type of your Elemental Connection. If you have Mystic Senses, these Attacks deal Normal Type Damage. Arcane Weapon users that qualified through Mystic Senses or Elemental Connection (Normal) gain a +5 Bonus to Damage Rolls and a +2 Bonus to Effect Range when using Arcane Weapon Attacks. When wielding an Arcane Weapon, you may resist Disarm Maneuvers with your Occult Education.

Smith.Prerequisites:
Rank 1: Skills Focus 3, Athletics 3
Rank 2: Skills Focus 3, Athletics 3
Smith.Effect:
Rank 1:You may create Simple Weapons for $1000, Light Shields for $1,500, and Light Armor for $4,000.
Rank 2:You may create Fine Weapons for $2,000, Helmets for $1,125, Heavy Shields for $2,250 and Heavy Armor for $5,000.

Type Sync.Prerequisites:
Edges Elemental Connection
Feature Type-Linked Class
Skills Medicine Education 4, Occult Education 4, Technology Education 4
Type Sync.Effect: The Target gains the Type of your Elemental Connection as an additional Type, or has one of their Types replaced by that Type. See the Type Changes sec- tion (page 436) for more information and suggestions. A Pokémon may be targeted by Type Sync only once. This Feature may be performed One Time for each Rank above Untrained you have of your highest of Medicine, Occult, or Tech Education, up to a maximum of 4 times at Master Rank.

Nurse.Effect:
During this Extended Rest, Pokémon and Trainers in your care gain the benefits listed below. The AP Drain cost from triggering this Feature is applied after the Extended Rest is completed and AP Drain has otherwise been restored.
» They heal 1/8th of their Max Hit Points per half hour of rest instead of 1/16th (does not stack with Bandages).
» If the Extended Rest lasts at least 6 hours, they may remove 1 Injury.

Gotta Catch 'Em All.Effect: Every time you Capture a Wild Pokémon that is a member of an evolutionary family of which you own no other Pokémon, you gain 1 Collector Stack. Whenever you make a Capture Roll, you may spend up to three Collector Stacks to gain an equal bonus to your Capture Roll, or you may spend three Collector Stacks to re-roll entirely.

Ace Trainer.Trigger: You spend at least half an hour Training your Pokémon
Ace Trainer.Effect: For each Pokémon that has been Trained during this time, choose a Stat besides HP; that Stat becomes Trained until an Extended Rest is taken. The default State of Trained Stats is +1 Combat Stages instead of 0. A Pokémon may have only one Trained Stat at a time.

Perseverance.Effect: The target instead does not gain an Injury. Perseverance may activate only once per Scene per target.

Elite Trainer.Effect: Choose Agility Training, Brutal Training, Focused Training, or Inspired Training. You gain the chosen Feature, even if you do not meet the prerequisites. When training, you may apply up to two different [Training] Features on each of your Pokémon. If you already have all of these Features, instead pick another Feature for which you qualify.

Critical Moment.Effect: The bonuses from your Pokemon's [Training] are tripled until the end of your next turn.

Top Percentage.Trigger: Your Pokémon levels up to a Level evenly divisible by 5
Top Percentage.Effect: Your Pokémon gains an extra Tutor Point. Top Percentage may be used on a single Pokémon a maximum of 4 times. Once a Pokémon has gained 4 Tutor Points in this way, increase each of that Pokémon's Base Stats by +1.

Signature Technique.Trigger: Your Pokémon with at least 2 Tutor Points remaining
Signature Technique.Effect: The target loses 2 Tutor Points. Choose one Move on the Target's Move List. That Move becomes the target's Signature Technique, and you may apply one of the modifications on the next page to the Move. The Move being modified must fit the category of the modification, and you must have the associated Training Feature to apply a modification. A Pokémon may only have one Signature Technique at a time. If you choose to teach a Pokémon a different Signature Technique, the old one is lost, and 1 Tutor Point is refunded. 1 Tutor Point is also refunded if the Pokémon ever forgets a Signature Technique Move.

Champ in the Making.Prerequisites:
Feature Any Ace Trainer, Any Ace Trainer, Any Ace Trainer, Any Ace Trainer
Skills Command 6
Champ in the Making.Trigger: You use Ace Trainer to give Pokémon Trained Stats
Champ in the Making.Effect: Choose two Trained Stats for each Pokémon instead of one. A Pokémon may only have two Trained Stats this way.

Capture Specialist.Prerequisites: Skills Acrobatics 3, Athletics 3, Stealth 3, Survival 3, Guile 3, Perception 3
Capture Specialist.Effect: You gain two Capture Techniques of your choice, found on the next page. You must meet any prerequisites of the Technique.

Advanced Capture Techniques.Prerequisites:
Rank 1: Feature Capture Specialist
Rank 2: Feature Capture Specialist
Skills Acrobatics 4, Athletics 4, Stealth 4, Survival 4, Guile 4, Perception 4, Acrobatics 4, Athletics 4, Stealth 4, Survival 4, Guile 4, Perception 4
Rank 3: Feature Capture Specialist
Skills Acrobatics 5, Athletics 5, Stealth 5, Survival 5, Guile 5, Perception 5, Acrobatics 5, Athletics 5, Stealth 5, Survival 5, Guile 5, Perception 5
Rank 4: Feature Capture Specialist
Skills Acrobatics 5, Athletics 5, Stealth 5, Survival 5, Guile 5, Perception 5, Acrobatics 5, Athletics 5, Stealth 5, Survival 5, Guile 5, Perception 5, Acrobatics 5, Athletics 5, Stealth 5, Survival 5, Guile 5, Perception 5
Advanced Capture Techniques.Effect: At each Rank, you gain two Capture Techniques of your choice, found on the next page. You must meet any prerequisites of the Technique. You may qualify for Advanced Capture Techniques' prerequisites with the Acrobatics, Athletics, Stealth, Survival, Guile, or Perception Skills only.

Captured Momentum.Effect:
Choose One Effect:
» You or your Pokémon gain a +2 bonus to their next Accuracy Roll during this combat.
» You subtract your highest Skill Rank out of Acrobatics, Athletics, Stealth, Survival, Guile, or Perception from your next Capture Roll during this combat.
» You gain 1 Temporary Action Point that disappears after one full round.

Gotta Catch 'Em All.Effect: You may switch the rolled digits on your 1d100 roll. For example, if you roll a 91, that can be switched to a 19. This does not turn a roll of 1 into a "Natural" roll of 100.

Commander.Effect: Choose one of Ravager Orders, Marksman Orders, Trickster Orders, Guardian Orders, or Precision Orders. You gain the chosen Feature, even if you do not meet its prerequisites.

Mobilize.Effect: The target cannot provoke Attacks of Opportunity on their next turn. Mobilize may target an Ally only once per encounter.

Leadership.Effect: You may use [Orders] that have targets to target any Ally, even if normally those [Orders] would only let you apply the effect to your own Pokemon. Any other conditions still apply.

Battle Conductor.Trigger: You give [Orders] with a Frequency of At-Will that have targets
Battle Conductor.Effect: You may target up to two additional Allies with the [Orders].

Complex Orders.Prerequisites: Feature Commander, Tags Orders, Target 1, Tags Orders, Target 1
Complex Orders.Effect: You may choose a different Order to give to each Target. You must pay all AP costs and follow Frequency restrictions for all Orders used in this way.

Tip the Scales.Effect: Your [Orders] with an At-Will Frequency instead target all allies within 10 Meters.

Scheme Twist.Trigger: You give [Orders] with a Daily or Scene Frequency that have Targets.
Scheme Twist.Effect: You may target up to two additional Allies with the [Orders].

Coordinator.Prerequisites:
Edges Grace
Skills Charm 3, Command 3, Guile 3, Intimidate 3, Intuition 3
Coordinator.Effect: Your Pokémon may reroll a single Appeal Roll or Damage Roll. This Feature may be used only once per Contest, and once per Pokémon per Scene.

Decisive Director.Effect: Add or subtract X from the target's Initiative until the end of your next turn. X is equal to your Charm Rank doubled.

Adaptable Performance.Trigger: Your Pokémon's Turn to use a Move in a Contest
Adaptable Performance.Effect: Choose two of your Pokémon's Moves. Your Pokémon may perform your Contest Move as if had the Contest Typing of one of your chosen Moves, and had the effects of the other. You may not use either move on the next round of the contest. This effect may be used once per Contest.

Flexible Preparations.Prerequisites:
Feature Adaptable Performance
Skills Charm 4, Command 4, Guile 4, Intimidate 4, Intuition 4
Flexible Preparations.Target: A Pokémon that has Contest Stats from Poffins
Flexible Preparations.Effect: The target may reallocate up to 2d6 of Poffin-Derived Contest Stats from one Contest Stat to another. This effect lasts until the end of the day.

Innovation.Target: A Pokémon with at least 1 Tutor Point.
Innovation.Effect: The target loses 1 Tutor Point, and then learns a Move created with Innovation. See the next section for details on creating Moves for this Feature. A Pokémon may only have one Move created by Innovation at a time.

Nuanced Performance.Prerequisites:
Feature Coordinator
Skills Charm 5, Command 5, Guile 5, Intimidate 5, Intuition 5
Nuanced Performance.Trigger: Your Pokémon miss all targets with a Move
Nuanced Performance.Effect: That Move's Frequency is not expended. This does not work with Moves that may fail to activate, such as moves with the Execute keyword.

Reliable Performance.Prerequisites:
Feature Nuanced Performance
Skills Charm 6, Command 6, Guile 6, Intimidate 6, Intuition 6
Reliable Performance.Trigger: Your Pokémon makes an Appeal Roll, Accuracy Check, or Skill Check
Reliable Performance.Effect: For appeal rolls, instead of making the Appeal Roll, you gain 1 Appeal Point for each Dice you would have rolled. For Accuracy Checks, act as if you had rolled a 10. For Skill Checks, multiply 3.5 by your Pokémon's Skill Rank, and use the resulting number as the result of your roll, rounded down. For all rolls, add or subtract any modifiers as normal.

Hobbyist.Effect: You gain three Skill Edges for which you qualify.

Dilettante.Prerequisites:
Rank 1: Feature Hobbyist
Rank 2: Feature Hobbyist
Rank 3: Feature Hobbyist
Rank 4: Feature Hobbyist
Dilettante.Effect: Each Rank of Dilettante, you gain both an Edge and a General Feature from the lists below. You may gain the chosen Edge and Feature even if you do not meet the Skill prerequisites. You must meet any other Prerequisites. Whenever you gain a Feature or Edge this way, change any Skill Rank applications or Skill Checks mandated directly by the Edge or Feature into your choice of General Education or Perception Skill Checks or Rank applications instead.

Dabbler.Prerequisites:
Feature Hobbyist
Skills Perception 5, General Education 5
Dabbler.Effect: At the Level 5, 10, 20, 30, and 40 Character Advancement Level Milestones, if you choose to gain Bonus Stats, you also gain an Edge for which you qualify. If you choose Bonus Edges or Features, you also gain +2 to your choice of Attack or Special Attack. This applies retroactively.

Look and Learn.Prerequisites:
Feature Hobbyist
Skills Perception 5, General Education 5
Look and Learn.Effect: When you activate Look and Learn, you may gain any of the Features below even though they are Features from other Classes. You do not need to meet their normal prerequisites, but you must meet their Prerequisites listed here. Look and Learn can be used two times; once to learn a Feature from the "Scene Features" List, and once to learn a Feature from the "Action Point Features List".

Mentor.Prerequisites: Skills Charm 3, Intimidate 3, Intuition 3, Pokémon Education 3, Charm 3, Intimidate 3, Intuition 3, Pokémon Education 3
Mentor.Target: A Pokémon with at least 1 Tutor Point remaining
Mentor.Effect: The target loses 1 Tutor Point, and then learns a move from its tutor list marked with a (N), or any move on its level-up list learned at X Level or lower, where X is the target's current Level plus the sum of your Mentor Skill Ranks. Note that despite being Tutored, these Moves count as if they were "natural" for organizational purposes.

Lessons.Effect: You may perform any Mentor Lesson for which you qualify.

Expand Horizons.Effect: Your Pokémon gains 3 Tutor Points. A Pokémon may be targeted by Expand Horizons only once.

Guidance.Effect: Your Pokémon's base Move List Limit is increased by +1 (Reminder: The default Move List Limit is 6).

Move Tutor.Target: A Pokémon with at least 2 Tutor Points.
Move Tutor.Effect: The target loses 2 Tutor Points, and learns any move from its Tutor List.

Egg Tutor.Target: A Pokémon with at least 2 Tutor Points.
Egg Tutor.Effect: The target loses 2 Tutor Points, and learns any Move from its Egg Move List. A Pokémon may be targeted by Egg Tutor only one time.

Lifelong Learning.Effect: Your Pokémon may have up to 4 Moves from their Move List come from TMs or Move Tutors.

Cheerleader.Effect: Choose Cheered, Excited, or Motivated. All allies affected by the triggering effect gain the chosen condition. This Feature costs 0 AP if the triggering effect affects only one ally, and costs 1 AP if it affects two or more.

Cheer Brigade.Trigger: Your Pokémon with at least 2 Tutor Points remaining
Cheer Brigade.Effect: Your Pokémon loses 2 Tutor Points and gains the Friend Guard Ability.

Gleeful Interference.Trigger: Your Pokémon with the Friend Guard Ability hits a foe with a damaging attack
Gleeful Interference.Effect: The triggering foe gains a -2 penalty to Accuracy for one full Round.

Inspirational Support.Effect: You may trigger Cheerleader as a Free Action when your Pokémon with Friend Guard activate an Ability or Status Move that affects only allies.

Moment of Action.Effect: Each target gains 1 Temporary Action Point. These Action Points disappear after one full Round.

Go, Fight, Win!.Prerequisites:
Feature Moment of Action
Skills Charm 5
Go, Fight, Win!.Effect:
Choose and perform one of the cheers below. You may perform each Cheer only once per Scene.
» Show Your Best!: Choose Defense or Special Defense. All allies on the field gain +1 Combat Stage in the Chosen Stat and become Motivated.
» Don't Stop Now!: All allies on the field gain Temporary Hit Points equal to your Charm Rank and become Excited.
 I Believe In You!: All allies on the field gain a +2 bonus to Evasion for one full Round, and become Cheered.

Keep Fighting!.Prerequisites:
Feature Any Cheerleader, Any Cheerleader, Any Cheerleader, Any Cheerleader, Any Cheerleader
Skills Charm 6
Keep Fighting!.Trigger: Your Pokémon or an Ally Trainer with over 1 Hit Point is reduced to 0 Hit Points or lower
Keep Fighting!.Effect: That Ally's Hit Point count is reduced to 1 instead, and then gains Temporary Hit Points equal to your Charm Rank doubled.

Duelist.Effect:
The Foe becomes Tagged; or if the foe is already Tagged, the foe loses the Tag. Only one foe can be Tagged this way at a time. If a new Foe is Tagged, all other Tags are lost.
Your Pokémon under the effects of Focused Training gain half their Momentum (rounded up) as a Bonus to Accuracy and Evasion against Tagged Foes, but as long as a Foe is Tagged, they do not benefit from Focused Training's Accuracy Bonus against other foes.

Expend Momentum.Target: Your Pokémon under the effects of Focused Training
Expend Momentum.Effect:
Apply one of the following effects on the target by spending that much Momentum.
» Spend 1 Momentum: Your Pokémon regains use of an EOT Frequency Move.
» Spend 2 Momentum: Your Pokémon automatically rolls an 11 on one d20 Roll of your choice on their next turn.
» Spend 3 Momentum: Your Pokémon regains a use of Scene Frequency Move. May be chosen only once per Scene per Pokémon.

Effective Methods.Target: Your Pokémon with at least 2 Tutor Points remaining
Effective Methods.Effect: Your Pokémon loses 2 Tutor Points and gains your choice of the Exploit or Tolerance Ability. You may only target a Pokémon once with Effective Methods.

Directed Focus.Effect: Whenever your Pokémon with the Exploit or Tolerance Ability are targeted by an [Order], deal Super- Effective Damage, or take Super-Effective Damage, they gain +1 Momentum after all effects of the Move or Order are resolved.

Type Methodology.Effect:
Effects depend on whether your Pokémon has the Tolerance or Exploit ability.
» Whenever your Pokémon with Tolerance takes Super-Effective damage from a Tagged foe, your Pokémon may lose 2 Momentum to Resist that attack one step.
» Whenever your Pokémon with Exploit deals Resisted damage to a Tagged foe, your Pokémon may lose 2 Momentum to increase the effectiveness of the attack one step.

Duelist's Manual.Prerequisites:
Feature Expend Momentum, Effective Methods
Skills Focus 5
Duelist's Manual.Target: Your Pokémon under the effects of Focused Training
Duelist's Manual.Effect:
Apply one of the following effects. To choose an effect, your Pokémon must have a certain amount of Momentum. (Duelist's Manual does not spend Momentum).
» 1 Momentum: Your Pokémon doubles theirbonuses from Tolerance or Exploit until the end of their next turn and may change their Tolerance Ability into Exploit, or vice versa, until the end of their next turn.
» 2 Momentum: Your Pokémon's next Pass, Cone, Close Blast, or Burst attack becomes a single target Melee attack, or their next Line or Ranged Blast attack becomes a single target Ranged attack. If this attack hits, the target becomes Vulnerable for one full round and has their Initiative set to 0 until the end of their next turn.
» 3 Momentum: Your Pokémon may act while ignoring the Confused, Rage, Infatuation, and Suppressed Volatile Status on their next turn as long as they attempt to attack a Tagged foe. May only be used once per Scene per Pokémon.

Seize The Moment.Trigger: Your Pokémon would gain Momentum while already at 6 Momentum
Seize The Moment.Effect: Your Pokémon loses 6 Momentum, and then gains +1 Momentum. Your Pokémon may immediately make an attack as an Interrupt, but this attack must target only a Tagged Foe. If the attack misses, it still deals damage as if it had the Smite keyword. If the attack hits, it's automatically a Critical Hit. If it would have already been a Critical Hit, your Pokémon gains Hit Points equal to half of its maximum Hit Points. May be used only once per Scene per Pokémon .

Enduring Soul.Effect: You may add to your Pokémon's HP stat when they level up, ignoring Base Relation, and you do not need to "correct" Stats due to this inflated HP.

Staying Power.Effect: Your Pokémon may "Take a Breather" even if it is Confused or Enraged, and it does not Trip or have to Shift away from enemies as part of the action. You may choose whether or not your Pokémon resets their Combat Stages to default.

Shrug Off.Effect: Once per day, each of your Pokémon may spend a Shift Action to remove 1 Injury from themselves; this may also be activated as a Free Action whenever your Pokémon Take a Breather.

Awareness.Prerequisites: Feature Enduring Soul, 3 Pokémon with a Defensive Ability
Awareness.Effect: Your Pokémon add +2 to all Save Checks.

Resilience.Trigger: Your Pokémon is hit by a Critical Hit or gains a Status Affliction (or both)
Resilience.Effect: Your Pokémon does not gain a Status Affliction, and the triggering attack does damage as if it was not a Critical Hit. Resilience may only be used once per target per Scene.

Not Yet!.Prerequisites:
Feature Enduring Soul
Skills Athletics 5, Focus 5
Not Yet!.Trigger: Your Pokémon is Fainted, but is not at less than -100% Hit Points.
Not Yet!.Effect: Before fainting, the targeted Pokémon gains an Injury, and may then use a Move as an Interrupt. When the Move is resolved, the Pokémon then immediately faints. This consumes a Pokémon turn as normal. This cannot be used with the Moves Explosion, Pain Split, or Self-Destruct.

Vim and Vigor.Prerequisites:
Feature Shrug Off
Skills Athletics 6, Focus 6
Vim and Vigor.Trigger: Your Pokémon with at least 2 Tutor Points
Vim and Vigor.Effect: The target loses 2 Tutor Points, and gains the Vigor Ability.

Juggler.Prerequisites:
Feature Quick Switch
Skills Acrobatics 3, Guile 3
Juggler.Effect: Using Quick Switch costs only 1 AP. Whenever you send a Pokémon into an encounter from a Poké Ball, they receive a +10 bonus to their Initiative during that round.

Bounce Shot.Effect: After hitting its mark or landing, your Poké Ball bounces 3 meters in any direction. You may have your Poké Ball trigger captures or releases before or after the bounce.

Juggling Show.Effect: You may roll an additional Xd6 during the In- troduction Stage of a Contest, where X is half of your Acrobatics Rank. You may choose any Contest Stat to attempt to gain Dice for with this roll.

Round Trip.Effect: You may immediately switch your Pokémon that just performed a Move for another of your Pokémon. This effect lets Pokémon with the Trapped condition switch out.

Tag In.Prerequisites:
Feature Round Trip
Skills Acrobatics 5, Guile 5
Tag In.Effect: The next Pokémon you send out is treated as if the recalled Pokémon had used Baton Pass on it.

Emergency Release.Effect: The next Pokémon you send out is treated as if the recalled Pokémon had used Baton Pass on it.

First Blood.Prerequisites:
Feature Tag In
Skills Acrobatics 6, Guile 6
First Blood.Trigger: You release a Pokémon from its Poké Ball
First Blood.Effect: If you have a Pokémon turn available this round or next, your Pokémon may use a Move as an Interrupt as soon as it is sent out. This consumes your Pokémon turn for the round (or the following round) as normal.

Rider.Prerequisites:
Edges Mounted Prowess
Feature Agility Training
Skills Acrobatics 3, Athletics 3
Rider.Effect: While you are Mounted on a Pokemon under the effects of Agility Training, the bonuses from Agility Training are doubled.

Ramming Speed.Target: Your Pokémon with at least 2 Tutor Points
Ramming Speed.Effect: The target loses 2 Tutor Points and gains the Run Up Ability.

Conqueror's March.Prerequisites:
Feature Ramming Speed
Skills Acrobatics 4, Athletics 4
Conqueror's March.Effect: This round, if being used as a Mount, the target may use Dash, Burst, Blast, Cone, or Line range Moves with a range of Pass instead of their usual range.

Ride as One.Effect: While you are Mounted, you and your Mount each use the highest of each other's Speed Evasion. If both you and your Mount have the same Speed Evasion, you instead each receive a +1 bonus to Speed Evasion. Whenever one of you receives Initiative, either of you may take your turn. When the next person would receive initiative, the person that did not take their turn then takes it.

Lean In.Trigger: You and your Mount both take Damage from a Burst, Blast, Cone, or Line
Lean In.Effect: Both you and your Mount Resist the attack one step further.

Cavalier's Reprisal.Prerequisites:
Feature Ride as One
Skills Acrobatics 5, Athletics 5
Cavalier's Reprisal.Trigger: An adjacent foe hits your Mount with an attack
Cavalier's Reprisal.Effect: You may make a Struggle Attack against the triggering foe.

Overrun.Prerequisites:
Feature Conqueror's March
Skills Acrobatics 5, Athletics 5
Overrun.Trigger: Your Mount with Run Up makes a Damage Roll for a Dash or Pass Move
Overrun.Effect: Your Pokémon adds their Speed Stat in addition to their normal attacking Stat to their Damage Roll. The target gains Damage Reduction against this attack equal to their own Speed Stat.

Taskmaster.Trigger: You apply Brutal Training as a Training action
Taskmaster.Effect: You may grant your Pokémon up to three injuries. If your Pokémon has at least one Injury, it becomes Hardened.

Quick Healing.Effect: Your Hardened Pokémon may use Quick Healing to remove up to three injuries, and gains two Ticks of Hit Points for each Injury removed this way.

Savage Strike.Target: Your Pokémon with at least 2 Tutor Points
Savage Strike.Effect: The target loses 2 Tutor Points, and gains the Cruelty Ability.

Strike of the Whip.Effect:
You may apply 1 or more of the following effects to the Pokémon hit by Press:
» Give the target 1 Injury and a Tick of Temporary Hit Points.
» Spend 1 AP and cure the target of Confusion, Infatuation, Rage, and Suppression.
» Use an [Order] you know with targets on the target as a Free Action.

Pain Resistance.Trigger: Your Pokémon with 1 or more injuries takes Damage
Pain Resistance.Effect: Your Pokémon gains X Damage Reduction against the triggering attack, where X is its Tick Value multiplied by the number of Injuries it has. This may be triggered once per Scene per Pokémon.

Press On!.Effect:
Your Hardened Pokemon gain the following benefits, based on your Intimidate Rank
» Expert: When your Pokemon Faints, you may pay 1 AP. If you do, your Pokemon Faints at -30% Hit Points instead.
» Master: While acting at 0 Hit Points or less, your Pokemon's Critical Hit, Effect Range, Evasion, Initiative, Damage Reduction, and Resistance Bonuses from being Hardened are doubled.

Desperate Strike.Trigger: Your Pokémon triggers Cruelty, or scores a Critical Hit with damaging attack.
Desperate Strike.Effect: Your Pokemon may apply the effects of Cruelty to the attack without expending Cruelty's Frequency. Cruelty's effects may be purchased as if the foe had additional injuries equal to the number of injuries on the user. Desperate Strike may be used once per Scene per Pokémon.

Deadly Gambit.Prerequisites:
Feature Any Taskmaster, Any Taskmaster, Any Taskmaster, Any Taskmaster, Any Taskmaster
Skills Intimidate 6
Deadly Gambit.Trigger: Your Pokémon is the target of a foe's damaging melee attack
Deadly Gambit.Effect: The triggering attack automatically hits as if it was a Critical Hit. Before damage resolves, your Pokémon may use a 1-Target damaging attack on the foe making the triggering attack as an Interrupt, Frequency allowing, and also automatically hits as a Critical Hit. Damage for both attacks then resolve at the same time.

Trickster.Trigger: Your Pokémon hits a foe with a Status-Class Move or a foe triggers your Pokémon's Hazard
Trickster.Effect: After the Move is resolved, your Pokémon may perform a Dirty Trick or Manipulate Maneuver on that foe as a Free Action. The Maneuver automatically hits, but the target must be in range for the chosen Maneuver. Use your own Guile to resolve Manipulate Rolls.

Bag of Tricks.Prerequisites:
Rank 1: Feature Trickster
Rank 2: Feature Trickster
Bag of Tricks.Effect: You gain two Trickster Techniques of your choice, found on the next page.

Stacked Deck.Trigger: Your Pokémon hits a foe suffering from a Status Affliction or one of the other conditions in the table below
Stacked Deck.Effect: Choose a Status Affliction or condition the triggering target is suffering from; the target suffers an additional effect according to the table below. Stacked Deck may only affect a foe once per Scene.

Flourish.Effect:
Your Pokémon's Status-Class Moves that affect foes ignore non-Stat Evasion. They may Critically Hit like damaging Moves on a roll of 20. Upon such a Critical Hit, choose one effect from the list below. This Critical Hit rate may be modified as normal.
» If the Move inflicts a Status Affliction with a Save Check, all affected targets get a -4 penalty to their first Save Check.
» If the Move lowers Combat Stages, then pick a Stat that the Move lowers and lower it by 1 additional Combat Stage.
» Your Pokémon gains a Tick of Temporary Hit Points.

Encore Performance.Prerequisites:
Feature Any Trickster, Any Trickster, Any Trickster
Skills Guile 5
Encore Performance.Trigger: Your Pokémon uses a Status-Class Move that does not target foes.
Encore Performance.Effect: Choose One: Your Pokémon gains +1 Combat Stage in any Stat in which they haven't gained a Combat Stage this turn; or gains a second Standard Action this round that must be used to make an At-Will action that does not trigger Encore Peformance; or, if they are placing Hazards, they may place an additional two units; or, if they are activating a Weather Effect, it lasts an additional two turns; or, if they are activating a Blessing, it gains an additional use.

Sleight.Prerequisites:
Feature Any Trickster, Any Trickster, Any Trickster, Any Trickster
Skills Guile 6
Sleight.Effect: Your Pokémon may activate Sleight as an Interrupt to immediately take their turn and use a Status- Class Move as a Standard Action. If this Move targets a foe, it ignores Substitute and Defensive Abilities, and Blessings may not be activated against the Move.

Stat Ace.Prerequisites: 1=Feats=Ace Trainer, Style Expert (Cool), Skills=Command=3, Focus=3, Other=1 Pokémon with 15 or more Attack, 2=Skills=Command=3, Focus=3, Other=3 Pokémon with 20 or more Attack
Stat Ace.Effect: Your Pokémon have their Base Attack increased by +1, and by +1 more for every 10 Levels they have (for example, a Level 20 Pokémon would have their Base Attack increased by +3). Additionally, your Pokémon may ignore Base Relations, as long as they are adding to Attack, and you do not need to "correct" Stats due to this inflated Stat Value.

Stat Link.Trigger: At the end of your Pokémon's turn, their Attack Stat is at its default number of Combat Stages or less.
Stat Link.Effect: The triggering Pokémon gains +1 Combat Stage to Attack. (Note: The "Default" number of Combat Stages is usually 0)

Stat Training.Target: Your Pokémon with at least 1 Tutor Point
Stat Training.Effect: Your Pokémon loses 1 Tutor Point and learns Swords Dance or Rage, even if your Pokémon cannot normally learn either move

Stat Maneuver.Effect: You may activate this Feature to cause one of your Pokémon to use a Physical "Melee, 1-Target" Move as if its range was "Melee, Pass" or "Melee, 3-Targets" instead.

Stat Mastery.Effect: When your Pokémon successfully uses a Push, Disarm, or Dirty Trick Combat Maneuver, the target of the Maneuver loses a Tick of Hit Points.

Stat Embodiment.Prerequisites: Feats=Any Stat Ace (Attack), Any Stat Ace (Attack), Any Stat Ace (Attack), Any Stat Ace (Attack)
Stat Embodiment.Effect: Your Pokémon gains either Sheer Force or Defiant for the remainder of the Scene. Switching does not end this effect. Stat Embodiment may only grant one Ability to a Pokémon at a time. If it is used a second time on the same target, it replaces the first granted Ability.

Stat Stratagem.Effect: While this Feature is Bound, the target's damaging Melee Attacks have their Critical Hit Range increased by 1 for each positive Combat Stage they have in Attack, up to a maximum of +3.

Stat Ace.Prerequisites: 1=Feats=Ace Trainer, Style Expert (Tough), Skills=Command=3, Focus=3, Other=1 Pokémon with 15 or more Defense, 2=Skills=Command=3, Focus=3, Other=3 Pokémon with 20 or more Defense
Stat Ace.Effect: Your Pokémon have their Base Defense increased by +1, and by +1 more for every 10 Levels they have (for example, a Level 20 Pokémon would have their Base Defense increased by +3). Additionally, your Pokémon may ignore Base Relations, as long as they are adding to Defense, and you do not need to "correct" Stats due to this inflated Stat Value.

Stat Link.Trigger: At the end of your Pokémon's turn, their Defense Stat is at its default number of Combat Stages or less.
Stat Link.Effect: The triggering Pokémon gains +1 Combat Stage to Defense. (Note: The "Default" number of Combat Stages is usually 0)

Stat Training.Target: Your Pokémon with at least 1 Tutor Point
Stat Training.Effect: Your Pokémon loses 1 Tutor Point and learns Iron Defense or Reflect, even if your Pokémon cannot normally learn either move

Stat Maneuver.Effect: You may activate this Feature whenever your Pokémon is hit by a Physical Attack to receive the blow as if your Pokémon's Defense Combat Stages were at +6 instead of their current value.

Stat Mastery.Effect: Whenever your Pokémon do not spend their Shift Action to Shift during a turn, they gain +5 Damage Reduction for one full round.

Stat Embodiment.Prerequisites: Feats=Any Stat Ace (Defense), Any Stat Ace (Defense), Any Stat Ace (Defense), Any Stat Ace (Defense)
Stat Embodiment.Effect: Your Pokémon gains either Filter or Battle Armor for the remainder of the Scene. Switching does not end this effect. Stat Embodiment may only grant one Ability to a Pokémon at a time. If it is used a second time on the same target, it replaces the first granted Ability.

Stat Stratagem.Effect: While this Feature is Bound, the target gains a +2 bonus to Save Checks against Paralysis, Sleep, and Freeze for each positive Combat Stage they have in Defense, up to a maximum of +6.

Stat Ace.Prerequisites: 1=Feats=Ace Trainer, Style Expert (Beauty), Skills=Command=3, Focus=3, Other=1 Pokémon with 15 or more Special Attack, 2=Skills=Command=3, Focus=3, Other=3 Pokémon with 20 or more Special Attack
Stat Ace.Effect: Your Pokémon have their Base Special Attack increased by +1, and by +1 more for every 10 Levels they have (for example, a Level 20 Pokémon would have their Base Special Attack increased by +3). Additionally, your Pokémon may ignore Base Relations, as long as they are adding to Special Attack, and you do not need to "correct" Stats due to this inflated Stat Value.

Stat Link.Trigger: At the end of your Pokémon's turn, their Special Attack Stat is at its default number of Combat Stages or less.
Stat Link.Effect: The triggering Pokémon gains +1 Combat Stage to Special Attack. (Note: The "Default" number of Combat Stages is usually 0)

Stat Training.Target: Your Pokémon with at least 1 Tutor Point
Stat Training.Effect: Your Pokémon loses 1 Tutor Point and learns Nasty Plot or Hidden Power, even if your Pokémon cannot normally learn either move

Stat Maneuver.Effect: You may activate this Feature to allow your Pokémon to use a Special Burst, Cone, Close Blast, Ranged Blast, or Line of any size as a Burst 1, Cone 2, Close Blast 2, or Line 4 instead.

Stat Mastery.Effect: The Range of your Pokémon's Special Non-Melee Moves is increased by +2. This does not affect the size of Area-Of-Effect moves (But does affect the range at which you can place Ranged Blasts)

Stat Embodiment.Prerequisites: Feats=Any Stat Ace (Special Attack), Any Stat Ace (Special Attack), Any Stat Ace (Special Attack), Any Stat Ace (Special Attack)
Stat Embodiment.Effect: Your Pokémon gains either Tinted Lens or Competitive for the remainder of the Scene. Switching does not end this effect. Stat Embodiment may only grant one Ability to a Pokémon at a time. If it is used a second time on the same target, it replaces the first granted Ability.

Stat Stratagem.Prerequisites:
Feats=Stat Link (Special Attack)
Stat Training (Special Attack)
Stat Stratagem.Effect: While this Feature is Bound, the target's damaging Ranged Attacks have their Effect Range increased by 1 for each positive Combat Stage they have in Special Attack, up to a maximum of +3.

Stat Ace.Prerequisites: 1=Feats=Ace Trainer, Style Expert (Smart), Skills=Command=3, Focus=3, Other=1 Pokémon with 15 or more Special Defense, 2=Skills=Command=3, Focus=3, Other=3 Pokémon with 20 or more Special Defense
Stat Ace.Effect: Your Pokémon have their Base Special Defense increased by +1, and by +1 more for every 10 Levels they have (for example, a Level 20 Pokémon would have their Base Special Defense increased by +3). Additionally, your Pokémon may ignore Base Relations, as long as they are adding to Special Defense, and you do not need to "correct" Stats due to this inflated Stat Value.

Stat Link.Trigger: At the end of your Pokémon's turn, their Special Defense Stat is at its default number of Combat Stages or less.
Stat Link.Effect: The triggering Pokémon gains +1 Combat Stage to Special Defense. (Note: The "Default" number of Combat Stages is usually 0)

Stat Training.Target: Your Pokémon with at least 1 Tutor Point
Stat Training.Effect: Your Pokémon loses 1 Tutor Point and learns Amnesia or Light Screen, even if your Pokémon cannot normally learn either move

Stat Maneuver.Effect: You may activate this Feature whenever your Pokémon is hit by a Special Attack to receive the blow as if your Pokémon's Special Defense Combat Stages were at +6 instead of their current value.

Stat Mastery.Effect: Whenever your Pokémon would lose a Tick of Hit Points from Status Afflictions, Weather, or other effects, they lose 5 fewer Hit Points, to a minimum of 1.

Stat Embodiment.Prerequisites: Feats=Any Stat Ace (Special Defense), Any Stat Ace (Special Defense), Any Stat Ace (Special Defense), Any Stat Ace (Special Defense)
Stat Embodiment.Effect: Your Pokémon gains either Multiscale or Tolerance for the remainder of the Scene. Switching does not end this effect. Stat Embodiment may only grant one Ability to a Pokémon at a time. If it is used a second time on the same target, it replaces the first granted Ability.

Stat Stratagem.Prerequisites:
Feats=Stat Link (Special Defense)
Stat Training (Special Defense)
Stat Stratagem.Effect: While this Feature is Bound, the target gains a +2 bonus to Save Checks against Confusion, Rage, and Infatuation for each positive Combat Stage they have in Special Defense, up to a maximum of +6.

Stat Ace.Prerequisites: 1=Feats=Ace Trainer, Style Expert (Cute), Skills=Command=3, Focus=3, Other=1 Pokémon with 15 or more Speed, 2=Skills=Command=3, Focus=3, Other=3 Pokémon with 20 or more Speed
Stat Ace.Effect: Your Pokémon have their Base Speed increased by +1, and by +1 more for every 10 Levels they have (for example, a Level 20 Pokémon would have their Base Speed increased by +3). Additionally, your Pokémon may ignore Base Relations, as long as they are adding to Speed, and you do not need to "correct" Stats due to this inflated Stat Value.

Stat Link.Trigger: At the end of your Pokémon's turn, their Speed Stat is at its default number of Combat Stages or less.
Stat Link.Effect: The triggering Pokémon gains +1 Combat Stage to Speed. (Note: The "Default" number of Combat Stages is usually 0)

Stat Training.Target: Your Pokémon with at least 1 Tutor Point
Stat Training.Effect: Your Pokémon loses 1 Tutor Point and learns Agility or After You, even if your Pokémon cannot normally learn either move

Stat Maneuver.Effect: You may activate this Feature at any time to cause your Pokémon to use a Move as Priority or a Priority Move as Priority (Advanced).

Stat Mastery.Effect: Your Pokémon may take Disengage Maneuvers as Swift Actions.

Stat Embodiment.Prerequisites: Feats=Any Stat Ace (Speed), Any Stat Ace (Speed), Any Stat Ace (Speed), Any Stat Ace (Speed)
Stat Embodiment.Effect: Your Pokémon gains either Speed Boost or Vanguard for the remainder of the Scene. Switching does not end this effect. Stat Embodiment may only grant one Ability to a Pokémon at a time. If it is used a second time on the same target, it replaces the first granted Ability.

Stat Stratagem.Effect: While this Feature is Bound, the target's Movement Capabilities are increased by 1 for each positive Combat Stage they have in Speed, up to a maximum of +3.

Style Expert.Prerequisites: 1=Feats=Coordinator, Other=1 Pokémon with 3d6 in their Tough Stat from Poffins, 2=Other=3 Pokémon with 3d6 in their Tough Stat from Poffins
Style Expert.Effect: Your Pokémon gain +2d6 to their Tough Stat. These dice are counted as if coming from Poffins.

Style Flourish.Prerequisites: Feats=Any Style Expert (Tough), Any Style Expert (Tough), Any Style Expert (Tough)
Style Flourish.Trigger: Your Pokémon uses a Tough Move
Style Flourish.Effect:
In Contests: Re-Roll all dice that result in 1s. This effect may only be used once per Contest.
In Battle: The target gains +1 CS to their Defense, after the Move and all effects have been resolved. This may only affect a target once per Scene.

Style Entrainment.Prerequisites: Feats=Any Style Expert (Tough), Any Style Expert (Tough), Any Style Expert (Tough), Any Style Expert (Tough)
Style Entrainment.Effect: Your Pokémon gains either Sturdy or Intimidate for the rest of the Scene, even if it is switched out. Style Entrainment may only grant one Ability to a Pokémon at a time. If it is used a second time on the same target, it replaces the first granted Ability.

Tough Tumble.Effect:
Your Pokémon with at least 3d6 in their Tough Stat from Poffins may activate Tough Tumble as a Standard Action to perform one of the following Moves. They must still follow frequency limits as usual for these Moves.

Rank 1:: Scary Face, Spite
Rank 2:: Glare, Bide

Macho Charge.Trigger: Your Pokémon uses a Tough-Type Move
Macho Charge.Effect:
In Contests: Treat the Move as if it were one step more aligned with the Contest Type. If the Move would be opposing the Contest Type, it is instead neutral. If it is neutral, it is instead matching. You may activate this effect only once per Contest.
In Battles: All targets hit by the Move are pushed away from the triggering Pokémon by 3 meters. You may activate Macho Charge only once per Pokémon per Scene.

Endurance.Trigger: Your Pokémon takes falling damage, begins to suffocate, or is Heavily Injured.
Endurance.Effect: Your Pokémon can ignore up to X meters of falling when calculating falling damage, act without beginning to suffocate for X additional rounds, or ignore the Hit Point loss effects from acting while Heavily Injured for X rounds. X is equal to half its number of Tough Dice from Poffins.

Style Expert.Prerequisites: 1=Feats=Coordinator, Other=1 Pokémon with 3d6 in their Smart Stat from Poffins, 2=Other=3 Pokémon with 3d6 in their Smart Stat from Poffins
Style Expert.Effect: Your Pokémon gain +2d6 to their Smart Stat. These dice are counted as if coming from Poffins.

Style Flourish.Prerequisites: Feats=Any Style Expert (Smart), Any Style Expert (Smart), Any Style Expert (Smart)
Style Flourish.Trigger: Your Pokémon uses a Smart Move
Style Flourish.Effect:
In Contests: Re-Roll all dice that result in 1s. This effect may only be used once per Contest.
In Battle: The target gains +1 CS to their Special Defense, after the Move and all effects have been resolved. This may only affect a target once per Scene.

Style Entrainment.Prerequisites: Feats=Any Style Expert (Smart), Any Style Expert (Smart), Any Style Expert (Smart), Any Style Expert (Smart)
Style Entrainment.Effect: Your Pokémon gains either Analytic or Anticipation for the rest of the Scene, even if it is switched out. Style Entrainment may only grant one Ability to a Pokémon at a time. If it is used a second time on the same target, it replaces the first granted Ability.

Smart Scheme.Effect:
Your Pokémon with at least 3d6 in their Smart Stat from Poffins may activate Smart Scheme as a Standard Action to perform one of the following Moves. They must still follow frequency limits as usual for these Moves.

Rank 1:: Fake Tears, Calm Mind
Rank 2:: Taunt, Flatter

Calculated Assault.Trigger: Your Pokémon uses a Smart-Type Move
Calculated Assault.Effect:
In Contests: Treat the Move as if it were one step more aligned with the Contest Type. If the Move would be opposing the Contest Type, it is instead neutral. If it is neutral, it is instead matching. You may activate this effect only once per Contest.
In Battles: Choose one: The triggering Pokémon gains a +1 bonus on its Accuracy Roll for each ally that hit a target of its Move this round, or all allies get a +1 bonus to their Accuracy Rolls against targets of the triggering Pokémon's Move until the end of your Pokémon's next turn. You may activate Calculated Assault only once per Pokémon per Scene.

Learn From Your Mistakes.Trigger: Your Pokémon fails a Skill Check.
Learn From Your Mistakes.Effect: Your Pokémon may re-roll the Skill Check with a Bonus equal to its number of Smart Dice from Poffins.

Style Expert.Prerequisites: 1=Feats=Coordinator, Other=1 Pokémon with 3d6 in their Cute Stat from Poffins, 2=Other=3 Pokémon with 3d6 in their Cute Stat from Poffins
Style Expert.Effect: Your Pokémon gain +2d6 to their Cute Stat. These dice are counted as if coming from Poffins.

Style Flourish.Prerequisites: Feats=Any Style Expert (Cute), Any Style Expert (Cute), Any Style Expert (Cute)
Style Flourish.Trigger: Your Pokémon uses a Cute Move
Style Flourish.Effect:
In Contests: Re-Roll all dice that result in 1s. This effect may only be used once per Contest.
In Battle: The target gains +1 CS to their Speed, after the Move and all effects have been resolved. This may only affect a target once per Scene.

Style Entrainment.Prerequisites: Feats=Any Style Expert (Cute), Any Style Expert (Cute), Any Style Expert (Cute), Any Style Expert (Cute)
Style Entrainment.Effect: Your Pokémon gains either Cute Charm or Cute Tears for the rest of the Scene, even if it is switched out. Style Entrainment may only grant one Ability to a Pokémon at a time. If it is used a second time on the same target, it replaces the first granted Ability.

Cute Cuddle.Effect:
Your Pokémon with at least 3d6 in their Cute Stat from Poffins may activate Cute Cuddle as a Standard Action to perform one of the following Moves. They must still follow frequency limits as usual for these Moves.

Rank 1:: Charm, Block
Rank 2:: Teeter Dance, Attract

Gleeful Steps.Trigger: Your Pokémon uses a Cute-Type Move
Gleeful Steps.Effect:
In Contests: Treat the Move as if it were one step more aligned with the Contest Type. If the Move would be opposing the Contest Type, it is instead neutral. If it is neutral, it is instead matching. You may activate this effect only once per Contest.
In Battles: The triggering Pokémon may immediately shift up to half their Movement speed in meters in any direction after their attack is resolved. You may activate Gleeful Steps only once per Pokémon per Scene.

Let's Be Friends!.Effect: The target may attempt to improve the disposition of a Wild Pokémon as if making a Charm Check. They roll their Cute Dice from Poffins and add their number of Cute Dice from Stats as a modifier. For example, a Pokémon with 4d6 Cute from Poffins and 3d6 Cute from Speed rolls 4d6+3 in place of a Charm Check.

Style Expert.Prerequisites: 1=Feats=Coordinator, Other=1 Pokémon with 3d6 in their Cool Stat from Poffins, 2=Other=3 Pokémon with 3d6 in their Cool Stat from Poffins
Style Expert.Effect: Your Pokémon gain +2d6 to their Cool Stat. These dice are counted as if coming from Poffins.

Style Flourish.Prerequisites: Feats=Any Style Expert (Cool), Any Style Expert (Cool), Any Style Expert (Cool)
Style Flourish.Trigger: Your Pokémon uses a Cool Move
Style Flourish.Effect:
In Contests: Re-Roll all dice that result in 1s. This effect may only be used once per Contest.
In Battle: The target gains +1 CS to their Attack, after the Move and all effects have been resolved. This may only affect a target once per Scene.

Style Entrainment.Prerequisites: Feats=Any Style Expert (Cool), Any Style Expert (Cool), Any Style Expert (Cool), Any Style Expert (Cool)
Style Entrainment.Effect: Your Pokémon gains either Defiant or Sniper for the rest of the Scene, even if it is switched out. Style Entrainment may only grant one Ability to a Pokémon at a time. If it is used a second time on the same target, it replaces the first granted Ability.

Cool Conduct.Effect:
Your Pokémon with at least 3d6 in their Cool Stat from Poffins may activate Cool Conduct as a Standard Action to perform one of the following Moves. They must still follow frequency limits as usual for these Moves.

Rank 1:: Focus Energy, Noble Roar
Rank 2:: Roar, Double Team

Rule of Cool.Trigger: Your Pokémon uses a Cool-Type Move
Rule of Cool.Effect:
In Contests: Treat the Move as if it were one step more aligned with the Contest Type. If the Move would be opposing the Contest Type, it is instead neutral. If it is neutral, it is instead matching. You may activate this effect only once per Contest.
In Battles: The triggering Move's Crit Range is increased by 3, and the Moves with the Interrupt Keyword may not be activated in reaction to this Move. You may activate Rule of Cool only once per Pokémon per Scene.

Action Hero Stunt.Trigger: Your Pokémon makes a Skill Check for a dramatic, high risk action
Action Hero Stunt.Effect: Instead of using a Skill for this Check, your Pokémon rolls their Cool Dice from Poffins and adds their number of Cool Dice from Stats as a modifier. For example, a Pokémon with 5d6 Cool from Poffins and 2d6 from Attack rolls 5d6+2. Skill Checks invoked by Intercepting attacks, Combat Maneuvers, Moves, and Abilities don't trigger this Feature.

Style Expert.Prerequisites: 1=Feats=Coordinator, Other=1 Pokémon with 3d6 in their Beauty Stat from Poffins, 2=Other=3 Pokémon with 3d6 in their Beauty Stat from Poffins
Style Expert.Effect: Your Pokémon gain +2d6 to their Beauty Stat. These dice are counted as if coming from Poffins.

Style Flourish.Prerequisites: Feats=Any Style Expert (Beauty), Any Style Expert (Beauty), Any Style Expert (Beauty)
Style Flourish.Trigger: Your Pokémon uses a Beauty Move
Style Flourish.Effect:
In Contests: Re-Roll all dice that result in 1s. This effect may only be used once per Contest.
In Battle: The target gains +1 CS to their Special Attack, after the Move and all effects have been resolved. This may only affect a target once per Scene.

Style Entrainment.Prerequisites: Feats=Any Style Expert (Beauty), Any Style Expert (Beauty), Any Style Expert (Beauty), Any Style Expert (Beauty)
Style Entrainment.Effect: Your Pokémon gains either Gentle Vibe or Serene Grace for the rest of the Scene, even if it is switched out. Style Entrainment may only grant one Ability to a Pokémon at a time. If it is used a second time on the same target, it replaces the first granted Ability.

Beautiful Ballet.Effect:
Your Pokémon with at least 3d6 in their Beauty Stat from Poffins may activate Beautiful Ballet as a Standard Action to perform one of the following Moves. They must still follow frequency limits as usual for these Moves.

Rank 1:: Captivate, Mist
Rank 2:: Lovely Kiss, Mean Look

Fabulous Max.Trigger: Your Pokémon uses a Beauty-Type Move
Fabulous Max.Effect:
In Contests: Treat the Move as if it were one step more aligned with the Contest Type. If the Move would be opposing the Contest Type, it is instead neutral. If it is neutral, it is instead matching. You may activate this effect only once per Contest.
In Battles: The move gains the keyword Burst 1 if Melee, or Blast 2 if ranged. If the move is already a Burst, Blast, or Cone, increase the size of the Move's Range by 1. This does not cause a target to be hit multiple times. You may activate Fabulous Max only once per Pokémon per Scene.

Enticing Beauty.Effect: The target acts as a Bait item as if it had the Alluring Capability. Add its number of Beauty Dice from Poffins as a Bonus to all d20 lure rolls.

Type Ace.Prerequisites: 1=Edges=Elemental Connection (Water), Skills=Athletics=3, Intuition=3, Other=1 Water-Type Pokémon, 2=Skills=Athletics=3, Intuition=3, Other=2 Different Water-Type Pokémon
Type Ace.Target: Your Pokémon with at least 2 Tutor Points remaining.
Type Ace.Effect: The target loses 2 Tutor Points and learns Last Chance (Water) or Type Strategist (Water). You may target a Pokémon only once with Type Ace.

Type Refresh.Effect: The target regains one use of a Water-Type Scene-Frequency Move, and refreshes the Frequency of all Water-Type EOT-Frequency Moves. A Target can be affected by Type Refresh only once per Scene.

Move Sync.Prerequisites: Feats=Any Type Ace (Water), Any Type Ace (Water), Any Type Ace (Water)
Move Sync.Target: Your Pokémon with at least 1 Tutor Point.
Move Sync.Effect: The target loses 1 Tutor Point. Pick a Move in the target's Move List. The picked move is now permanently Water-Type, and may have different effects. See the Types Changes section (page 468) for more information and suggestions. A Pokémon may have only one Move-Sync'd Move in their Move List at a time; to Sync a new Move, the old Move must be forgotten.

Flood!.Effect: Your Water-Type Pokemon may activate Flood! as a Shift Action to use a damaging Water-Type Move as if had a range of Line 4 or Close Blast 2 instead of its usual range.

Fishbowl Technique.Effect: While this Stratagem is bound, your Pokémon may activate Moves and Abilities as if they were in Rainy Weather.

Fountain of Life.Trigger: Your Water-Type Pokémon hits with a damaging Water-Type attack
Fountain of Life.Effect: You may choose to take a penalty to the Damage Roll for the attack up to triple your Type-Linked Skill Rank or up to half the rolled damage for the triggering attack, whichever is lower. Your Pokémon gains twice that value in Temporary Hit Points and may cure themselves of one Status Affliction. Fountain of Life may only be used once per Scene per Pokémon.

Aqua Vortex.Trigger: Your Pokémon hits with a damaging Water-Type attack
Aqua Vortex.Effect: All targets of the attack are put in a Vortex, and take a penalty to all Damage Rolls equal to your Type- Linked Skill Rank while in the Vortex.

Type Ace.Prerequisites: 1=Edges=Elemental Connection (Steel), Skills=Athletics=3, Intimidate=3, Other=1 Steel-Type Pokémon, 2=Skills=Athletics=3, Intimidate=3, Other=2 Different Steel-Type Pokémon
Type Ace.Target: Your Pokémon with at least 2 Tutor Points remaining.
Type Ace.Effect: The target loses 2 Tutor Points and learns Last Chance (Steel) or Type Strategist (Steel). You may target a Pokémon only once with Type Ace.

Type Refresh.Effect: The target regains one use of a Steel-Type Scene-Frequency Move, and refreshes the Frequency of all Steel-Type EOT-Frequency Moves. A Target can be affected by Type Refresh only once per Scene.

Move Sync.Prerequisites: Feats=Any Type Ace (Steel), Any Type Ace (Steel), Any Type Ace (Steel)
Move Sync.Target: Your Pokémon with at least 1 Tutor Point.
Move Sync.Effect: The target loses 1 Tutor Point. Pick a Move in the target's Move List. The picked move is now permanently Steel-Type, and may have different effects. See the Types Changes section (page 468) for more information and suggestions. A Pokémon may have only one Move-Sync'd Move in their Move List at a time; to Sync a new Move, the old Move must be forgotten.

Polished Shine.Effect: The Effect Range of your Pokémon's Steel-Type Moves is increased by +2.

Iron Grit.Effect: When this Feature becomes Bound, the target gains +1 Defense Combat Stage. While the Feature remains bound, the target's Defense Stat cannot be lowered, and its Defense Combat Stages cannot be lowered.

Assault Armor.Trigger: Your Steel-Type Pokémon is hit by a damaging attack
Assault Armor.Effect: Your Pokémon gains Damage Reduction against the attack equal to your Type-Linked Skill Rank. Additionally, calculate Type Effectiveness with this attack as if your Pokémon has no Typings besides Steel.

Type Ace.Prerequisites: 1=Edges=Elemental Connection (Rock), Skills=Combat=3, Survival=3, Other=1 Rock-Type Pokémon, 2=Skills=Combat=3, Survival=3, Other=2 Different Rock-Type Pokémon
Type Ace.Target: Your Pokémon with at least 2 Tutor Points remaining.
Type Ace.Effect: The target loses 2 Tutor Points and learns Last Chance (Rock) or Type Strategist (Rock). You may target a Pokémon only once with Type Ace.

Type Refresh.Effect: The target regains one use of a Rock-Type Scene-Frequency Move, and refreshes the Frequency of all Rock-Type EOT-Frequency Moves. A Target can be affected by Type Refresh only once per Scene.

Move Sync.Prerequisites: Feats=Any Type Ace (Rock), Any Type Ace (Rock), Any Type Ace (Rock)
Move Sync.Target: Your Pokémon with at least 1 Tutor Point.
Move Sync.Effect: The target loses 1 Tutor Point. Pick a Move in the target's Move List. The picked move is now permanently Rock-Type, and may have different effects. See the Types Changes section (page 468) for more information and suggestions. A Pokémon may have only one Move-Sync'd Move in their Move List at a time; to Sync a new Move, the old Move must be forgotten.

Gravel Before Me.Trigger: Your Rock-Type Pokémon misses all targets with a Rock-Type attack, receives an Injury, suffers a Critical Hit, or Faints.
Gravel Before Me.Effect: Create a Stealth Rock Hazard adjacent to your Pokémon.

Bigger and Boulder.Trigger: Your Pokémon hits with a damaging Rock-Type Move
Bigger and Boulder.Effect: All targets hit by the triggering Move are pushed a number of meters equal to half your Type-Linked Skill Rank or less, and they become Vulnerable for one full round. Create a Stealth Rock Hazard adjacent to each foe hit this way.

Tough as Schist.Effect: While this Feature is Bound, allied Stealth Rock Hazards within 4 meters of your Pokémon are not used when a foe triggers them unless you want them to be. Whenever the target takes Super-Effective Damage from a Water, Grass, Ground, Fighting, or Steel Type Attack, they may consume an allied Stealth Rock Hazard within 4 meters to create temporary armor that grants them Damage Reduction equal to your Type-Linked Skill Rank for one full round.

Gneiss Aim.Trigger: Your Pokémon misses with a Damaging Rock-Type Move
Gneiss Aim.Effect: The Move gains the Smite keyword for that use.

Type Ace.Prerequisites: 1=Edges=Elemental Connection (Psychic), Skills=Focus=3, Occult Education=3, Other=1 Psychic-Type Pokémon, 2=Skills=Focus=3, Occult Education=3, Other=2 Different Psychic-Type Pokémon
Type Ace.Target: Your Pokémon with at least 2 Tutor Points remaining.
Type Ace.Effect: The target loses 2 Tutor Points and learns Last Chance (Psychic) or Type Strategist (Psychic). You may target a Pokémon only once with Type Ace.

Type Refresh.Effect: The target regains one use of a Psychic-Type Scene-Frequency Move, and refreshes the Frequency of all Psychic-Type EOT-Frequency Moves. A Target can be affected by Type Refresh only once per Scene.

Move Sync.Prerequisites: Feats=Any Type Ace (Psychic), Any Type Ace (Psychic), Any Type Ace (Psychic)
Move Sync.Target: Your Pokémon with at least 1 Tutor Point.
Move Sync.Effect: The target loses 1 Tutor Point. Pick a Move in the target's Move List. The picked move is now permanently Psychic-Type, and may have different effects. See the Types Changes section (page 468) for more information and suggestions. A Pokémon may have only one Move-Sync'd Move in their Move List at a time; to Sync a new Move, the old Move must be forgotten.

Psionic Sponge.Effect: Your Psychic-Type Pokémon may activate Psychic Sponge as a Shift Action to add a Psychic Type Move known by an ally within X meters to their Move List until the end of their turn. This does not allow them to have duplicate Moves in their Move List. This Feature may only be used once per Pokémon per Scene, and X is equal to your Type-Linked Skill Rank.

Mindbreak.Effect: While this Feature is Bound, the target's damaging Psychic-Type Moves gain a +1 Bonus to Effect Range and a +3 Bonus to Damage Rolls for each of the following conditions that the target is suffering: Bad Sleep, Confusion, Curse, Disabled, Flinch, Infatuation, Rage, or Suppression.

Psychic Resonance.Trigger: Your Pokémon hits a foe with a Psychic-Type Status Move
Psychic Resonance.Effect: Your Pokémon may use the Move Encore against the triggering foe, as if it was on their Move List.

Force of Will.Trigger: Your Pokémon uses a Psychic-Type Status Move with a range of Blessing, Field, Hazard, or Self.
Force of Will.Effect: Your Pokémon may immediately use another Psychic-Type Status Move from its Move List with a range of Blessing, Field, Hazard, or Self.

Type Ace.Prerequisites: 1=Edges=Elemental Connection (Poison), Skills=Charm=3, Intuition=3, Other=1 Poison-Type Pokémon, 2=Skills=Charm=3, Intuition=3, Other=2 Different Poison-Type Pokémon
Type Ace.Target: Your Pokémon with at least 2 Tutor Points remaining.
Type Ace.Effect: The target loses 2 Tutor Points and learns Last Chance (Poison) or Type Strategist (Poison). You may target a Pokémon only once with Type Ace.

Type Refresh.Effect: The target regains one use of a Poison-Type Scene-Frequency Move, and refreshes the Frequency of all Poison-Type EOT-Frequency Moves. A Target can be affected by Type Refresh only once per Scene.

Move Sync.Prerequisites: Feats=Any Type Ace (Poison), Any Type Ace (Poison), Any Type Ace (Poison)
Move Sync.Target: Your Pokémon with at least 1 Tutor Point.
Move Sync.Effect: The target loses 1 Tutor Point. Pick a Move in the target's Move List. The picked move is now permanently Poison-Type, and may have different effects. See the Types Changes section (page 468) for more information and suggestions. A Pokémon may have only one Move-Sync'd Move in their Move List at a time; to Sync a new Move, the old Move must be forgotten.

Potent Venom.Trigger: Your Poison-Type Pokémon inflicts Poison on a foe
Potent Venom.Effect: The foe does not necessarily lose Special Defense Combat Stages from Poison; instead, they lose Combat Stages in the Combat Stat of your choice. Whenever the target loses Hit Points from Poison, they lose additional Hit Points equal to your Type-Linked Skill Rank.

Debilitate.Effect: While this Feature is Bound, when the target successfully hits a Poisoned or Blighted foe with a Poison-Type Move, the foe gains a -2 penalty to Accuracy Rolls and Evasion for one full round.

Miasma.Trigger: Your Pokémon misses with a Poison-Type Move
Miasma.Effect: Your Pokémon may use either Smokescreen or Poison Gas as if they were on their Move List. When used this way, these Moves ignore Frequency Limitations, and are used as a Ranged Blast 3, with the blast centered on the square targeted by the triggering attack. Poison-Type Pokémon are not negatively affected by Smoke Screens created this way. Your Pokémon may also trigger Miasma deliberately as a Standard Action.

Corrosive Blight.Trigger: Your Pokémon hits a foe with a Poison-Type Attack
Corrosive Blight.Effect: The target gains the Blight Condition for one full round. Blighted targets lose a Tick of Hit Points upon being hit by any attack. If the attack is Poison-Typed, the Blight effect's duration is refreshed.

Type Ace.Prerequisites: 1=Edges=Elemental Connection (Normal), Skills=Charm=3, Intuition=3, Other=1 Normal-Type Pokémon, 2=Skills=Charm=3, Intuition=3, Other=2 Different Normal-Type Pokémon
Type Ace.Target: Your Pokémon with at least 2 Tutor Points remaining.
Type Ace.Effect: The target loses 2 Tutor Points and learns Last Chance (Normal) or Type Strategist (Normal). You may target a Pokémon only once with Type Ace.

Type Refresh.Effect: The target regains one use of a Normal-Type Scene-Frequency Move, and refreshes the Frequency of all Normal-Type EOT-Frequency Moves. A Target can be affected by Type Refresh only once per Scene.

Move Sync.Prerequisites: Feats=Any Type Ace (Normal), Any Type Ace (Normal), Any Type Ace (Normal)
Move Sync.Target: Your Pokémon with at least 1 Tutor Point.
Move Sync.Effect: The target loses 1 Tutor Point. Pick a Move in the target's Move List. The picked move is now permanently Normal-Type, and may have different effects. See the Types Changes section (page 468) for more information and suggestions. A Pokémon may have only one Move-Sync'd Move in their Move List at a time; to Sync a new Move, the old Move must be forgotten.

Extra Ordinary.Target: Your Normal-Type Pokémon with Last Chance or Normal Strategist.
Extra Ordinary.Effect: Your Pokémon gains the Last Chance or Normal Strategist Ability, whichever one they do not already have. Extra Ordinary can target a Pokémon only once.

Plainly Perfect.Effect: While this Feature is bound, instead of rolling for damage with Normal-Type Moves, your Pokémon acts as if they rolled the maximum value on their Damage Dice Roll. Plainly Perfect only works for the first instance of the Damage Dice Roll on Critical Hits.

New Normal.Trigger: Your Pokémon hits with a Normal-Type Move with conditional modifiers which increase or decrease its damage
New Normal.Effect: You use the highest damage value for the triggering Move. (Examples: Return is DB 9, Wring Out never has its damage decreased due to the target's Hit Points, Retaliate is DB 14) New Normal may only be used once per Scene per Pokémon. New Normal may not raise a Move's Damage Base above 14; if a Move would have its Damage Base raised above that value, it is instead raised to 14.

Simple Improvements.Effect: Add your Type-Linked Skill Rank to all of your Pokémon's rolls this turn. Your Pokémon gains Temporary Hit Points equal to twice your Type-Linked Skill Rank. Simple Improvements may only be used once per Scene per Pokémon.

Type Ace.Prerequisites: 1=Edges=Elemental Connection (Ice), Skills=Athletics=3, Survival=3, Other=1 Ice-Type Pokémon, 2=Skills=Athletics=3, Survival=3, Other=2 Different Ice-Type Pokémon
Type Ace.Target: Your Pokémon with at least 2 Tutor Points remaining.
Type Ace.Effect: The target loses 2 Tutor Points and learns Last Chance (Ice) or Type Strategist (Ice). You may target a Pokémon only once with Type Ace.

Type Refresh.Effect: The target regains one use of an Ice-Type Scene-Frequency Move, and refreshes the Frequency of all Ice-Type EOT-Frequency Moves. A Target can be affected by Type Refresh only once per Scene.

Move Sync.Prerequisites: Feats=Any Type Ace (Ice), Any Type Ace (Ice), Any Type Ace (Ice)
Move Sync.Target: Your Pokémon with at least 1 Tutor Point.
Move Sync.Effect: The target loses 1 Tutor Point. Pick a Move in the target's Move List. The picked move is now permanently Ice-Type, and may have different effects. See the Types Changes section (page 468) for more information and suggestions. A Pokémon may have only one Move-Sync'd Move in their Move List at a time; to Sync a new Move, the old Move must be forgotten.

Glacial Ice.Effect: Your Ice-Type Pokémon gain Damage Reduction equal to your Type-Linked Skill Rank against Fighting, Fire, Rock, and Steel-Typed Attacks from which they would take Super-Effective Damage.

Polar Vortex.Effect: While this Stratagem is bound, your Pokémon may activate Moves and Abilities as if they were in Hail.

Arctic Zeal.Trigger: Your Ice-Type Pokémon uses an Ice-Type Move
Arctic Zeal.Effect:
Your Pokémon uses the Move Mist as if it were on their Move List. When used this way, in addition to its normal effects, your Ice-Type Pokémon may expend uses of the Mist Blessing to do the following:
» As a Swift Action on their turn to cause a foe within 5 meters to take a -5 penalty to Damage Rolls and become Slowed for one full round.
» As a Free Action when being hit by a Fighting, Fire, Rock, or Steel-Typed attack dealing Super-Effective Damage to add their Tick Value to their Damage Reduction gained from Glacial Ice.
» As a Swift Action on their turn to increase their Defense or Special Defense by 1 Combat Stage.

Deep Cold.Trigger: Your Pokémon hits with a damaging Ice-Type Move
Deep Cold.Effect: The target is Frozen, and has their Attack, Special Attack, and Speed Combat Stages lowered by 1 each. The target is automatically cured of the Frozen Condition after 1 full round. A foe may be affected by Deep Cold only once per Scene.

Type Ace.Prerequisites: 1=Edges=Elemental Connection (Ground), Skills=Athletics=3, Survival=3, Other=1 Ground-Type Pokémon, 2=Skills=Athletics=3, Survival=3, Other=2 Different Ground-Type Pokémon
Type Ace.Target: Your Pokémon with at least 2 Tutor Points remaining.
Type Ace.Effect: The target loses 2 Tutor Points and learns Last Chance (Ground) or Type Strategist (Ground). You may target a Pokémon only once with Type Ace.

Type Refresh.Effect: The target regains one use of a Ground-Type Scene-Frequency Move, and refreshes the Frequency of all Ground-Type EOT-Frequency Moves. A Target can be affected by Type Refresh only once per Scene.

Move Sync.Prerequisites: Feats=Any Type Ace (Ground), Any Type Ace (Ground), Any Type Ace (Ground)
Move Sync.Target: Your Pokémon with at least 1 Tutor Point.
Move Sync.Effect: The target loses 1 Tutor Point. Pick a Move in the target's Move List. The picked move is now permanently Ground-Type, and may have different effects. See the Types Changes section (page 468) for more information and suggestions. A Pokémon may have only one Move-Sync'd Move in their Move List at a time; to Sync a new Move, the old Move must be forgotten.

Mold the Earth.Trigger: Your Pokémon with the Groundshaper Capability uses a Ground-Type Move
Mold the Earth.Effect: Your Pokémon may use the Groundshaper Capability as a Free Action. When used this way, Groundshaper creates Spike Hazards in each square turned into Rough or Slow Terrain. If you wish, instead of Groundshaper's normal range, you may choose to affect the square targeted by the attack and all cardinally adjacent squares. If the triggering Move is a Burst, Blast, Line, or Cone, you may choose to affect all squares in the targeted area instead.

Desert Heart.Effect: While this Stratagem is bound, your Pokémon may activate Moves and Abilities as if they were in a Sandstorm.

Earthroil.Effect: Your Ground-Type Pokémon may activate Earthroil as a Shift Action to use a damaging Ground-Type Move as it had a range of Line 4 or Burst 1 instead of its usual range, and as if it had the Groundsource keyword. 1-Target Moves performed this way take a -5 penalty to their Damage Rolls.

Upheaval.Trigger: Your Pokémon uses the Groundshaper Capability, or a Move with the Groundsource keyword
Upheaval.Effect: Your Pokémon may make a Trip Attempt as a Free Action against any Pokémon targeted by the Move, or standing on a square changed by the Groundshaper capability. Your Pokémon gains a bonus to their Combat Roll equal to half of your Type-Linked Skill Rank.

Type Ace.Prerequisites: 1=Edges=Elemental Connection (Grass), Skills=Survival=3, General Education=3, Other=1 Grass-Type Pokémon, 2=Skills=Survival=3, General Education=3, Other=2 Different Grass-Type Pokémon
Type Ace.Target: Your Pokémon with at least 2 Tutor Points remaining.
Type Ace.Effect: The target loses 2 Tutor Points and learns Last Chance (Grass) or Type Strategist (Grass). You may target a Pokémon only once with Type Ace.

Type Refresh.Effect: The target regains one use of a Grass-Type Scene-Frequency Move, and refreshes the Frequency of all Grass-Type EOT-Frequency Moves. A Target can be affected by Type Refresh only once per Scene.

Move Sync.Prerequisites: Feats=Any Type Ace (Grass), Any Type Ace (Grass), Any Type Ace (Grass)
Move Sync.Target: Your Pokémon with at least 1 Tutor Point.
Move Sync.Effect: The target loses 1 Tutor Point. Pick a Move in the target's Move List. The picked move is now permanently Grass-Type, and may have different effects. See the Types Changes section (page 468) for more information and suggestions. A Pokémon may have only one Move-Sync'd Move in their Move List at a time; to Sync a new Move, the old Move must be forgotten.

Foiling Foliage.Target: Your Pokémon with a Grass-Type Status Move
Foiling Foliage.Effect: Pick a Grass-Type Status-Class Move known by the target. The chosen Move no longer takes up a Move Slot. A Pokémon may have only one Move bypass the Move Limit at a time; if a new Move is chosen for a Pokémon, the previous Move loses this effect.

Sunlight Within.Effect: While this Stratagem is bound, your Pokémon may activate Moves and Abilities as if they were in Sunny Weather.

Enduring Bloom.Trigger: Your Grass-Type Pokémon is hit by a damaging Bug, Fire, Flying, Ice, or Poison attack that deals Super-Effective Damage
Enduring Bloom.Effect: Your Pokémon gains Temporary Hit Points equal to twice your Type-Linked Skill Rank, and gains +1 Combat Stage in the Stat of your choice. If it is Sunny, they may gain +1 Combat Stage in a second, different Stat. You may activate Enduring Bloom only once per Scene per Pokémon.

Cross-Pollinate.Trigger: Your Grass-Type Pokémon uses a damaging Grass-Type Move
Cross-Pollinate.Effect: Your Pokémon may immediately use a Grass-Type Status-Class move as a Free Action.

Type Ace.Prerequisites: 1=Edges=Elemental Connection (Ghost), Skills=Intimidate=3, Occult Education=3, Other=1 Ghost-Type Pokémon, 2=Skills=Intimidate=3, Occult Education=3, Other=2 Different Ghost-Type Pokémon
Type Ace.Target: Your Pokémon with at least 2 Tutor Points remaining.
Type Ace.Effect: The target loses 2 Tutor Points and learns Last Chance (Ghost) or Type Strategist (Ghost). You may target a Pokémon only once with Type Ace.

Type Refresh.Effect: The target regains one use of a Ghost-Type Scene-Frequency Move, and refreshes the Frequency of all Ghost-Type EOT-Frequency Moves. A Target can be affected by Type Refresh only once per Scene.

Move Sync.Prerequisites: Feats=Any Type Ace (Ghost), Any Type Ace (Ghost), Any Type Ace (Ghost)
Move Sync.Target: Your Pokémon with at least 1 Tutor Point.
